title: Basic Cardiology
description: The course will provide comprehensive coverage in basic anatomy, physiology, autonomic system, ECG interpretation, circulation control, molecular biology, endothelial function, hypertension, pregnancy, basic biostatistics and medical ethics.
outcome: Students are expected to acquire essential knowledge of basic anatomy, physiology, autonomic system, ECG interpretation, circulation control, molecular biology, endothelial function, hypertension, pregnancy, basic biostatistics and medical ethics through lectures, interactive case presentation and discussion.

instructors:
Professor FUNG Erik Yee Mun George, 
Professor LEE Pui Wai, 
Professor YAN Ping Yen Bryan

title: Clinical Cardiology I
description: This part will cover heart failure, valvular heart disease, acute coronary disease and cardiomyopathy.
outcome: Students are expected to acquire essential and up-to-date knowledge of heart failure, valvular heart disease, acute coronary disease and cardiomyopathy through lectures, interactive case presentation and discussion.

instructors:
Professor FUNG Erik Yee Mun George, 
Professor LEE Pui Wai, 
Professor YAN Ping Yen Bryan

title: Clinical Cardiology II
description: This part will focus on cardiac arrhythmia, adult congenital heart disease, pulmonary hypertension, risk stratification for non-cardiac surgery and management of cardiac emergency.

title: Clinical Seminar I
description: The seminar will be conducted in the form of problem-solving or case-based tutorial session. It will present cases employing an integrated cardiac approach which involves the use of various modalities of investigation and treatment.
outcome: Students are expected to acquire knowledge of problem-solving or case-based tutorial session. It will present cases employing an integrated cardiac approach which involves the use of various modalities of investigation and treatment through lectures, interactive case presentation and discussion.

instructors:
Professor FUNG Erik Yee Mun George, 
Professor LEE Pui Wai, 
Professor YAN Ping Yen Bryan

title: Clinical Seminar II
description: This seminar will present the latest advances in the diagnosis and management of cardiovascular diseases. It will cover a broad spectrum of topics encompassing cardiomyopathies, cardiac arrhythmia and device therapy, heart failure, coronary artery disease, interventional cardiology, echocardiography and cardiac imaging, hypertension, metabolic syndrome, cardiac and stroke rehabilitation, clinical trials as well as pharmacotherapy for various cardiac diseases.

title: Cardiac Procedures
description: It will be illustrated by videos and introduces basic knowledge of various cardiac investigations and procedures, including basic techniques and precautions.

title: Clinical Attachment
description: The one-week clinical attachment involves spending 5.5 days in rotation at the cardiac unit of the Prince of Wales Hospital. Students will acquire basic knowledge of the daily running and care of patients undergoing diagnostic and therapeutics cardiac procedures.

title: Dissertation
description: A 5,000-word dissertation in the form of topical review is required for graduation.
outcome: Under guidance of his/her supervisor, students are required to complete a dissertation in the form of topical review of about 5,000 words. Through the dissertation preparation, students both learn and demonstrate the ability to conduct independent, original, and significant research.

title: Advanced Clinical Seminar
requirements: Only for students of Master of Science in Cardiology
description: This seminar will include a series of comprehensive seminars focusing on latest advances in the diagnosis and management of cardiovascular diseases to internal and local healthcare professionals.

title: Advanced Clinical Cardiac Specialty Attachment
requirements: Only for students of Master of Science in Cardiology
description: The Advanced Clinical Cardiac Specialty Attachment involves spending a few days in rotation to different cardiac units at different times, observing how senior cardiologists looking after out-patient cardiac patients.
